my name is chad ladner i'm employed by
entergy services llc as a manager in the
transmission planning department i want
to give a brief summary of why this
project is needed for eml's customers in
the franklin county area and why the
expansion and upgrade of the existing
franklin 500 kb substation is necessary
and beneficial to address area
reliability in the southwest area of eml
service territory
the primary purpose of the proposed
electrical facilities and overall
project is to maintain compliance with
the nerf with the north american
electric reliability corporation
otherwise known as a nerf planting
criteria
modeling indicates that in the planning
event category p23 internal breaker
fault at the franklin switch yard
thermal overloads could occur in the
southwest area of eml's transmission
system
the proposed electric facilities are
needed to add breaker redundancy to
address that modeling thermal
overloading it could
result in the simultaneous loss of the
franklin 500
franklin to bogalusa and franklin to
make night 500 kb lines entergy's
planning process
seeks to ensure that existing and
forecasted load in the eml service
territory is reliably and adequately
served by the transmission grid as part
of the process entergy transmission
planning creates a model of the eml
transmission network entergy identified
potential transmission system
limitations that manifest in contingency
analysis performed using computer models
representing summer winter and light
load conditions
the proposed electric facilities were
submitted as a solution to the
identified transmission system
limitations in the m-tip 19 planning
process and the proposal was evaluated
by miso's planning personnel
the proposed electric facilities were
ultimately determined by the mysore
planning personnel to provide the most
effective alternative to remedy the
identified limitations
as a result this project was included in
appendix a of mtep19 and subsequently
approved by the miso board of directors
in december of 2019
with the project planned to be in
service by december of 2022
this project is the best solution to
enhance reliability and support
increasing load growth it is necessary
for entergy mississippi to continue to
provide safe and reliable electric
service in franklin county
without the construction of the proposed
electric facilities eml would not meet
the applicable reliability standards and
a system event could result in prolonged
facility overloads that can negatively
impact eml customers for these reasons
we request the commission approve our
request to construct the facilities
